meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a mob.
meanings.sent1: The loud and rowdy group had a mobbish behavior at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The chaotic scene in the movie was truly mobbish.
meanings.sent3: The mobbish crowd at the game made it hard to see the action.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley had a mobbish atmosphere that sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The mobbish graffiti on the wall gave the neighborhood a dangerous feel.

meanings.definition: Acting in a violent or unruly manner, like a mob.
meanings.sent1: The mobbish protesters clashed with the police in the streets.
meanings.sent2: The mobbish behavior of the fans led to chaos at the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The mobbish students caused a commotion in the school cafeteria.
meanings.sent4: The mobbish energy in the air was palpable during the riot.
meanings.sent5: The mobbish group stormed through the town, leaving destruction in their wake.
